byline.contributor: Ashley Southall contributed reporting from New York.
byline.original: By JOHN ELIGON and MITCH SMITH

abstract: Hundreds attend event in Ferguson, Mo, to remember Michael Brown, unarmed black 18-year-old who was shot dead by Police Officer Darren Wilson exactly on year earlier; call for changes to criminal justice system and underscore need to address unfair treatment of black American by police; engage in mile-and-a-half march to nearby church; similar demonstrations take place across country in sympathy.
lead_paragraph: A day of peaceful protest commemorating the killing of Michael Brown by a police officer one year ago ended in gunfire late Sunday. A St. Louis County police officer was involved in the shooting, the department said.

headline.main: Shots Are Fired as Anniversary Is Marked in Ferguson
headline.print_headline: Shots Fired as Anniversary Is Marked in Ferguson

snippet: A day of peaceful protest commemorating the killing of Michael Brown by a police officer one year ago ended in gunfire late Sunday. A St. Louis County police officer was involved in the shooting, the department said.
